controller.requests

Class RequestQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.ArrayDeque<Request>
        • controller.requests.RequestQueue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Request>, java.util.Collection<Request>, java.util.Deque<Request>, java.util.Queue<Request>

    public class RequestQueue
extends java.util.ArrayDeque<Request>
implements java.io.Serializable
    A utility class for collecting Requests and distributing them to RequestListeners. Intended to be used to maintain control flow in an organised fashion for (1) horizontal updates (eg Model to View) (2) vertical updates (eg Entity to Model) (3) asynchronous events (eg removing Trash outside of update loop)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      RequestQueue()
      Initialises an empty RequestQueue with no Requests or RequestListeners

      Hands over the given Request directly over to the listeners
